name: Norton House Hotel & Spa Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: We had buisness at Edinburgh university and stayed for five nights. Lovely relaxing atmosphere and wonderful staff. One night we went out to number one, a restaurant in town with one star in the Micheline guide. The next evening we went to the three rosette restaurant at Norton house. Guess where we got the best food? The best wine? The best service? At Norton house!!! Absolutely fantastic dinner and the best waiter (from Hungary originally) giving us an experience of food and wine, especially the Tokajer that we will never forget. The food was top of world class with a young and really amazing chef! Great value for the money!
reviews.title: An oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a dinner, bed and breakfast rate which was expensive but the hotel is worth it. From the first entrance we were made to feel welcome and valued. The room was a decent size, very clean and fresh with a large comfy bed, small sofa, mini bar and tray containing coffee, tea, biscuits and hot chocolate, dressing gowns and lovely toiletries. You also get your own cuddly cat on the end of the bed instead of a 'Do not disturb' sign - a nice touch!
reviews.title: Fantastic, relaxing weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: Dinner at the brasserie was very tasty especially the home-made ice cream. Breakfast was also great, continental buffet and a menu of hot options to choose from.
reviews.title: Fab hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa, which you get access to as a guest, was great too. A decent sized pool, nice big Jacuzzi style pool, experience shower, steam room and sauna. Comfy loungers round the pool for sitting and reading to relax. No availability for treatments though, so if you want one book in advance.
reviews.title: Fantastic Birthday Treat
What a 4 star hotel should be like
reviews.text: In conclusion, although expensive, you get what you pay for and more with this hotel. Great for a special occasion or a treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We got married in the Norton House last week. We had over 70 guests who were resident in the hotel, and despite the huge amount of organisation that went into this, the hotel staff were extremely helpful at all times. We also had a spa day on the Friday for approx 20 women, and the spa staff were endlessly patient with the hassled bride up until the last minute. On the day, the staff could not have been more helpful. There was not a single issue with any of the reservations. Every single guest commented on the beautiful food, the attention to detail (such as catering for vegetarians etc), how smoothly the event ran and how the staff were always on hand to help. Everyone was delighted with their bedrooms and loved the beautiful views. I even got a helper who waited on me while we got the photos taken, she went and got me some champagne which was the best thing anyone could have offered me! During the meal and the speeches our Duty Manager, Callum Briggs, was on hand to ensure that they whole event ran smoothly. Despite the fact that our speeches ran over, he was endlessly patient and somehow managed to have a smile on his face throughout. We sang songs and drank wine in the residents bar until 5am and were STILL made to feel very welcome. On checkout on Sunday, reception managed to deal with over 70 hungover and tired guests, we were all adding things to bills and swapping payments, and this was not a problem for the staff.
reviews.title: An excellent location, amazing staff and wonderful service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would, and will, recommend this hotel to anyone who is getting married or just looking for somewhere nice to stay for a weekend. Thank you Norton House for making our day so special.
reviews.title: Surprise For My Girlfriend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arranged the stay at the Norton House Hotel for my Girlfriends 21st and when we arrived there the staff were so inviting and treated us with the upmost respect. A personal Thanks to Jamie in the Reception as he arranged a complimentary upgrade on arrival. The Suite we stayed in(The Edinburgh Suite) was so beautiful my girlfriend could not believe her eyes. Food, Room and atmosphere was exceptional and I would like to say a big thanks to Piers Knowles who showed me the room and arranged all the surprises for my Girlfriend so discretely the way I wanted it and to ensure that she never had a clue. We also took part in the Spa Facilities which was so amazing and the Relaxsation was top class and a Big thanks to all staff at the hotel for an exceptional stay. We will definately be staying again in the near future :-).
reviews.title: Why we keep going back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The setting, spa and executive rooms are reason enough, but add the delicious fine dining restaurant ; a fantastic welcome every time; the room prepared just as we need it (as one of us uses a wheelchair) and it's the perfect recipe for a relaxing break. Chris and Piers (deputy and front of house Managers) really go out of their way every time to make us feel special, even arranging lovely unexpected little extras for a recent birthday visit. We live close enough that we could in theory travel home after the lovely meal, but all of this means that we will stay virtually every time - and keep returning.
reviews.title: First Anniversary Stay - Very Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Norton House for our first wedding anniversary after getting married there a year ago. We had very fond memories of our wedding – everything was perfect and the staff made sure our wedding was just how we wanted it.
reviews.title: The perfect place for a relaxing weekend break.
Service with a genuine smile!!
reviews.text: The purpose of my visit was two fold. To enjoy a 4 night relaxed stay but more importantly to propose to my partner. The staff at Norton House could not have been more helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spoke with the reservations manager and she was very helpful and really made me feel I had chosen the right place(which is her job but she was right). The staff on reception were extremely helpful and totally understand the importance of customer service. They were all eager to know what my partner said and were genuinely pleased for us!!
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was a great place to go and relaxed. The staff are extremely friendly and we could not have asked for more again.
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing that stood out for me was my last minute request for non alcoholic champagne. I spoke to a gentleman who may have been a senior manager to make my request and his answer was "if I don't have it here I will certainly go out and buy it for you sir" This in my opinion is what sets an average hotel apart from the more superior and service orientated.
reviews.title: Good spa, disappointing room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013
reviews.text: I am a Senior manager in a Luxury hotel myself so completely understand the importance of service. Norton House have it spot on. Thank you to ALL the staff for a wonderful experience and hopefully see you for our Anniversary celebrations. Rahim
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well, for years I have photographed weddings at the Norton. Having now retired it was a priviledge to be a guest at a wedding and not just the hired photographer on the big day. I can honestly say that in my opinion the complete function was a sucess. I must stress at this point that I was a guest and NOT the brides parents who were paying the bill.
reviews.title: A Scottish Wedding
A lovely wedding weekend!
reviews.text: As our family are spread far and wide, quite a few had rooms overnight. As we only live 15 minutes away, we chose not to stay. Our family that did stay were more than complimentary about the service, their rooms and the breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have always been concerned about the youthfulness of the majority of staff covering wedding functions.NO NEED, the young staff worked in total coreography and were absolutely faultless throughout the day.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The meal was perfect and even a NIT PICKING VIRGO like me could not complain. OK, the bar prices were not cheap. However it was a luxury hotel and not a local social club!!
reviews.title: Very Expensive to the extent of being a rip off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all with such beautiful grounds I would have to rate this wedding venue at 100%
reviews.title: Stairs, Stairs and More Stairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a one night stay, we got a one night DB&B deal from the website with lots thrown in - free champagne, upgraded room too. Food was very good - not in their 3-rosette restaurant but right next door so guessing it's the same kitchen... we used the pool facilities as well, really nice and luckily for us very quiet - we almost had the place to ourselves. Only downsides? Still a wee bit noise from Edinburgh airport and the bed was a bit too springy! Every time someone moved the whole bed rocked back and forth!
reviews.title: Fabulous get away-from-it stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: Family stay. Expensive. Great quality of decor and refurb. No management presence, no note of apology for fire alarm going off at 0715. Dreadful public accusation of 18 year old son being under age in restaurant. (law says 16, responsible drinking etc). Another supervisor in the restaurant rolling his eyes-cheek! Asked why- denied it. 9 year old spotted it. Odd. Ruined the stay for us. Great place, real shame about the attitude of some staff. Reception great, breakfast team excellent.
reviews.title: Quality good, service poor. No management presence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and myself had a wonderfull weekend at norton house. It was our ruby wedding and the little touches the hotel did for us made .us feel very special.
reviews.title: wonderfull hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: will definatelly be back.
reviews.title: Unwelcome Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I travel over from The Netherlands for a weekend stay, Arrived at Norton House around 10.50 pm, No greeting from reception I advise the receptionist that I just booked online via their Website about 20 min ago waited while she couldn’t find the booking, She was checking booking made via Agents and not the Norton House Hotel site, after a good 5 minutes “Oh I found in our reservation system” Doh….
reviews.title: Cleanliness of Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Norton House in September this year for our 1st wedding anniversary. From start to finish this was a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Just what your looking for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were shown to our Executive Room which was very well decorated and comfortable. We then sampled the leisure facilities which were excellent. Try the experience shower! After that it was on to dinner where we were served by a lovely lady (Corrie I believe her name was, from Fife). The food was excellent and very tasty. When we returned to our room we had a note from the mamagement saying that they anticipated breakfast to be busy and to feel free to have it ordered to our room which we did. In the morning breakfast came at the time we asked and was delicious. After checking out we used the leisure facilities to relax some more before heading home.
reviews.title: Style and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought the Heritage deal to stay which cost £179. For that we got to stay in an Executive Room, use the leisure facilities, have a 3 course dinner with no additional charges for anything on the menu, a glass of champagne, breakfast in bed with no additional charges and to top it off a copy of Series 1 of Downton Abbey to take home with us. I would say very good value for money! You can make it a little cheaper by getting a Classic Room.
reviews.title: Canal Cycle Trip, Glasgow to Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were 2 weddings going on during our stay however if we hadn't seen the happy couples getting pictures taken around the grounds we would have been none the wiser.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at reception, within the restaurant and at the leisure facilities were all very helpful and friendly. Corrie you are a jewel in the crown that is Norton House and they should be honoured to have you on their payroll. Its not so often these days that you get friendly service from someone that is smiling and looks happy to be doing their job.
reviews.title: 5 ***** Spa Day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Norton House Hotel is a real gem, hidden in surrounding countryside but still only a 20 minute taxi drive away from the centre of Edinburgh.
reviews.title: A fantastic place to stay, away from the hustle and bustle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at Norton House hotel a few times, we have used the location for birthday and christening parties and I also use the hotel whenever possible for business. The facilities are excellent, the staff always happy to help with a genuine smile, and the rooms on every occasion have been extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel & spa, but Brasserie very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast on our recent stay was a bit dissapointing, with pancakes that were luke warm and seemed to be from a packet rather than freshly made, but that's just a minor gripe.
reviews.title: Running out of superlatives to describe this gem of a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all a warm, friendly and comfortable hotel, just what is needed when staying away on business or on a family break.
reviews.title: Excellent from start to finish!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate enough to win a DBB voucher from Handpicked and chose Norton House as we live in Scotland. The hotel bedrooms are lovel - we were in a standard double and it more than met all of our needs. The spa is fab - a great facility and very ambient and makes the hotel well worth a visit. We were looking forward to dinner in the Brasserie. With a head chef who boasts three rosettes in the fine dining restaurant, we were sure that the Brasserie would be very good too. We did not find this to be the case. I ordered a rabbit terrine to start - it would have been very flavoursome served warm, but straight from a cold fridge, it didn't really work. My husband ordered the pate, which was fine though. We both ordered confit duck with toulouse sausage on a bean cassoulet for the main course. As one of the priciest main courses, we were expecting it to be packed full of rich meaty, winey flavour. It was very, very disappointing. The duck was OK, but the cassoulet was just tinned tomatoes and beans. I had two miniscule (and I mean miniscule) pieces of toulouse in the whole dish and my husband had none at all. the whole thing was lacklustre and pretty bland. We moved on to dessert. My husband ordered apple creme brulee - his favourite. What arrived was a creme anglaise with some crumble crumbs topped with apple sorbet. You can't mess with a creme brulee or call a deconstructed crumble one either! Finally, at breakfast the next morning, the waiter asked how we would like our poached eggs. I was impressed by this at the time and we both ordered soft ones. The eggs that got delivered though were hard - what is the point in even asking if you can't do it? My smoked haddock was a bit over cooked and my husband's kipper came complete with bone (and he assures this doesn't happen at other hotels...).
reviews.title: Very good spa
Best friends wedding
reviews.text: We were here for my friends wedding and we thought the venue and catering was first class! Staff were helpful and efficient and the meal was excellent! The buffer too was also great and in general it was a lovely wedding. We didn't stay the night but friends did and their room was lovely. Wish we'd stayed but we headed home as we actually live locally. Would return as I hear the afternoon tea is awrsome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I went here for an overnight stay and I wish we had been staying longer. The hotel is very clean and comfortable, the staff are amongst the best I have come across in a hotel and the food was very good (Bistro). We enjoyed using the Spa facilities and again, the staff there were friendly and very helpful. A real treat and I will be back (might take my husband next time!).
reviews.title: This is a real treat of a place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night as a treat and it's a lovely hotel. The food was delicious and couldn't fault the room or room service. Unfortunately a couple of little things meant the hotel wasn't excellent: we were only given 1 towel in the bedroom, the fish we had for dinner was not cooked (but was subsequently removed from the bill) and we had to wait an hour for our dinner to arrive despite quite an empty restaurant. All little things that didnt affect how much fun we had, but for a 4 star hotel we expected better.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel lacks finesse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say the food at Norton House Hotel is very good. The service however is not the best, i.e. had to ask for condiments etc.
reviews.title: Lunch @ Norton House Hotel
Lovely stay, delicious food, avoid rooms above hotel entrance
reviews.text: Also would advise not to have lunch in the bar as the tables are way too low to be able to enjoy your meal. They also attempt to charge me £5 for a coke.." Opps I am sorry I have charged you for a pint of coke not a bottle", i.e. should have been £2.50.

aka: Norton House Hotel And Spa Edinburgh
